review_title: Oh Puri, not your best work
review_detailed_main:
Vijay Deverakonda has a great screen presence and that might've saved him and Puri Jagnath in this film.

The first hour - of the movie was decent, the first fight scene was clean, the camera caught all hits in the right angle and flashed crisp moves. The curiosity of the movie was on the right track - meaning, quiet a few movies nowadays are pretentious after a few minuites in.

The characters's introductions were also adequet. Ramya Krishna's, Vijay, Ronit Roy and Ananya paday and Liger's fellow fighters. Ronit Roy's role as a coach was decent, he advised appropriatley but had not much importance later on in the movie. Ramya Krishna's role was decent until the second half. For example, her expressions and her chnage of positin was awkward when she tried to show off as a proud mother after Liger's MMA championshoip. She tried to emmunate her intensity onto the audiance as she did in Bahubali. And the frame there was blurry, it felt like Puri Jaganth did not polish the movie well.

Another place Puri did not polish well was when Liger was figting Mark Anderson, the camera did not deviate properly when Tyson punched Liger. And when Liger threw the last strike on Tyson, a lady's back covered the frame and did not show how Mark Anderson fell to ground. That was disappointing.

Mike Tyson was so random, he was working for some underworld mafia thing, and Liger fought him to save the heroine. What? If Tyson showed up at the International MMA Match as an advisor, or something relating to MMA he would of been more of a useful character and also would of recived some respect to his career. His role was very disappoiting.

The most diassapointing was the ending of the movie. It made me wonder if this movie was a about a random love story or actually about fighting. We don't even know if he won the International MMA. The love story was very random, like there was no emotional connection. She saw him fight and felt lust. The character had no scope. She mentioned going to Vegas to pursue acting but her dad says she is pursuing modeling. Another thing Puri, Nevada is a state and Vegas is in Nevada. Liger did not go to Nevada (again) to bring Tanya. Puri did not polish the movie and the dialogues were not polished either. As an audience I come to the movie to escape into another world, not to get confused.

Vijay Deverakond's acting was just a few stammering dialogues and fighting. Ananya Panday's acting was decent her character was bad so I can't seem to judge that well. Ramya Krishna's acting was overwhelming. Ronit Roy's acting had a lot of close up shots and so the lipsnching being off was very noticable.

Overall, the movie was very random, - random songs, random love story, random dailouges, and a lot of fights. The fights are only part I am not complaining about. At the least the movie is not pretentious, so I still like you Puri.

My rating 2.7/5 or I guess 6/10.

review_title: The most unbearable movie of the year
review_detailed_main:
All the main plot holes and rape culture celebration has been already called out in so many reviews. I would like to call out some lesser called out points that can still flop a movie by themselves: 1. Ananya Pandey: her character is unbearable. She believes the protagonist is an internet troll but falls in love with him the second she sees him fight. She gets kidnapped, but gets excited for a selfie with the kidnappers. She shames the hero so that he will get serious and work on his MMA goals, reminds me of my despicable teachers who used to beat us as kids for our own good. She and her gang talks like caricatures of bimbos in Hollywood comedies. I am sorry Ananya, but acting is not your thing.

2. Chunky Pandey: his character is so flamboyant that it beats some of the most stereotyped gay characters. He is so rich that he can fly a whole MMA club to US in charter but he does not pay back loans. He is cool with his daughter wandering Vegas strip when he owes money to criminal gangs. Most of what is wrong with his character is poor writing but sub par acting and a crappy accent makes it worse.

3. The Sanju character: he is the top contender for national MMA champion title, but he has no fighting scenes to attest his fighting skills. He is just painted as a villain who deserves a beating.

4. 'The' Vijay Devarakonda: 'The' superlative was part of the title scene. He has not earned it yet. He has continued his streak of choosing a misogynistic hero character.

5. US immigration: Chunkey Pandey's character has a guy in US embassy who gets Visas for Liger's team in a day. As an immigrant watching that from US, I felt like spitting on the screen. We wait months and years in line for the visa. This scene has no basis in fact.

6. Liger's dad was a fighter whose nick name was Lion. Liger gets his name because his dad was nicknamed Lion and his mother calls herself a Tigress. There isn't a single scene where this is justified. The temple scene proves she is dumb, her demanding free MMA training for her son proves she is needy and all scenes prove she is loud. None of them are characteristics of a Tiger. Ergo, the movie's name is BS.

7. Jokes: it will just suffice to say that they are very poor jokes 8. What boxing movie has no training montage? That could have been something watchable for a few mins.

9. The fights: street fights are shown in great detail but the actual MMA championship is shown few seconds each round.

Some of the actors and movie makers have recently spoken against the negative reviews and how it is effecting them. This movie is still in theaters and not in OTT yet. Which means all the negative reviews are from people who actually paid and watched this in a theater. There is no refund policy for a bad movie. And the makers and actors have already profited from our hard earned ticket money. This is an unavoidable repercussion for making a bad movie. Man/woman up and deal with it.

review_title: Liger- A tale without a tail
review_detailed_main:
Liger is a 2022 Pan Indian film directed by puri Jagannath. Starring Vijay Devarakonda, Ananya Pandey in leads, supported by Ramya Krishnan, Ronit Roy and also Mike Tyson in form of a cameo.

Story- Liger is a boy from karimnagar( TS) who gets shifted with his mother to the wide spreaded Mumbai. As he has plans to be prepared for MMA which isnt a course but a league called Mixed Martial Arts from a coach/leader (Ronit Roy). The reason behind opting him as a coach, should be watched while it contains a tinge of a twist. When gets the chance of showing his skills ,he proves and becomes a part of the coaching institute. After adapting all the techniques and having defeated the opponent in national levels he paves the way to the MMA league. How and what difficulties he faced during this ,should be watched (not really).

Overview and impressions The flick directed by puri is moreover a commercial and illogical one. The only positive in this movie is the "vijay" . He did his best, as the true work can be seen . But also because of his over confidence led the movie to a dip. The dubbing seems to be very week. The Songs weren't really good and appears suddenly. This what happens when each song is composed by different composers . Although bgm was somewhat good. It suites to the vijay's transformation. Liger is seen with stammering issues which is ok but after few mins it gets annoying.

Dir Puri known for his mass taking, makeover of the hero, impactful dialogues and many more tried to do the same here but it failed miserably. Comparing it with his previous Flicks was a big blunder done by the people.

The dialogues throughout the film felt shrinking and didn't make any impact.

Editing and screenplay were drowsy in their forms

The Characterisation of Ananya Pandey may fulfil to few masses. However her way of acting was intolerable and prodding.

Entire training scenes of Vijay were shown motivating also in such a way that it could make you demotivated because of the descending screenplay.

Mother sentiment added is a big drawback.

Nowadays every film is concentrating on the mothers to make their sons monsters.

Their role is just to motivate you and nothing else. Caring and affection can be seen in few movies.

Biggest factor "Fight" ,itself is missing in it as every match of the league gets covered in a song"attack". Except this song solid fights cannot be seen in the Movie. Felt the fights could've been more .

Abrupt climax. Misuse of Mike Tyson. I don't know why but it seemed Mike Tyson's cameo was senseless and lethargic.

Verdict It was puri who messed it up and not vijay. Liger is therefore a spoiled broth by the creators. It's definitely not worth the hype nor the words.

Hoping for a solid comeback for the duo with "Jana Gana Mana".

Liger review :

The titular hero is said to be a crossbreed of lion and tigress which means he is fiercely braveheart. The film itself is a crossbreed of Telugu Cinema and Bollywood (Kjo is co-producer) which explains why the talentless Ananya Pandey is cast as the heroine opposite Vijay Deverakonda The end result is a super silly actioner which would only add to the big budget flops piling up in Bollywood since the last few months...

An aspring mixed martial arts (MMA) champ who falls for a richie rich 'ladki' only to get spurned by her later due to his chronic stammer; Liger neither convinces nor entertains!! The hero's mamma (Ramya Krishnan) only screams and yells at the camera. Infact, the tempo of the film is forever hyper that Chunky Pandey appearing as Ananya ke docile pitaji in second half appears the most nuanced character of them all. Help!!

I had seen Vijay before in Arjun Reddy (2017) and the actor can certainly fire if he gets a good script. Unfortunately, Liger doesn't give him any scope. The stammer appears forced at times and doesn't really add value to the narrative. As for the much touted Mike Tyson cameo, the whole thing turns out to be an extended joke the legend would certainly regret to be a part of. There is also a well conceived fight between Liger and a dozen trained women fighters which appears promising at first but is whiled away completely when the hero tamely submits himself to them instead of touching them. Ouch!!

The last Hindi film Puri Jagannadh directed was Amitabh Bachchan's Bbuddah Hoga Terra Baap (2011) which was a spoof on the angry young man phenomenon and irrespective of its box office fate, I found it fun. Comparatively, Liger misses its target by miles!!

Regards, Sumeet Nadkarni.

My rating : 1/10 Performances : Vijay Deverakonda has put enormous effort in bodybuilding, to dub as a stammering character, and mainly to act in this tougher role. His fights are excellent, and so is the dance in Coka Song & Akdi Pakdi. Full marks to the hero and the director in this aspect.

Ananya Panday on her debut in Tollywood is quite impressive. She is very glamorous with her screen presence and at the same time, amazed everyone with her performance too.

Ramya Krishnan as Vijay Deverakonda's mother shined in her role. Her ferocity and intensity are what a passionate mother needs and she portrays the same.

Mike Tyson, the international champ is undoubtedly the special attraction of the film. His presence lights up the screen and the spirit of the film. His scenes with Vijay Deverakonda are spellbinding.

Vishnu Reddy is okay in his limited role. Ronit Roy as a boxing coach is decent. Other artists such as Getup Srinu are okay in their respective roles.

Technical values : Director Puri Jagannadh's basic idea of making a film on mother sentiment and incorporating action part in it is good but completely dilutes the proceedings with his routine template writing.

The background score composed by Sunil Kashyap is okay. Songs composed by various musicians are good.

The cinematography work by Vishnu Sharma is okay as he tried to showcase the locations in the USA on a colourful note.

The action episodes are the best part of the entire film and the credit goes to the stunt director Kecha and his team.

Dharma Productions & Puri Connects production values are good.

Highlights : Vijay Deverakonda Performance Action Sequences First Half

Drawbacks : Routine Story & Screenplay Direction.

review_title: Watching the Struggler - Ananya and Vijay Anaconda on Screen is Just Mission Impossible !!!
review_detailed_main:
Liger sticks out like a sore thumb in Puri's career - calling this his worst film too is an understatement. He takes the audience for a ride while not even making a basic effort to tell a story or entertain. The film is a big, plain bore. The screenplay is a gargantuan mess - Puri is clueless in driving conversations in his sequences. His precise, straightforward dialogues were once his USP; in Liger, he is now a pale shadow of his past.

The rags-to-riches story is mounted without the slightest hint of authenticity. Vijay Deverakonda's stammering is the only trace of vulnerability in the film. Contrastingly, Liger is filled with scenes where every second character takes a dig at him for the same reason. There are only two women who play a key role in Liger's life - his mother, who constantly reminds him of his ambitions and a girlfriend who's a mannequin-equivalent and keeps distracting him from his dreams.

Ananya Panday's Tanya is a classic example of Puri reducing the women in his films as objects. Tanya's pals advise her to use her physique to make a mark on Instagram and even have the gall to tell her, 'guys check out girls from bottom to top' and she doesn't mind the idea at all. This is precisely how Puri visualises the female leads in most of his films and unfortunately, this doesn't come as a surprise. Ramya Krishna keeps referring to Tanya as a devil in Liger - but the devil is the writing here.

The film pompously quotes Bruce Lee as a philosopher and places Mike Tyson as an inspirational figure in the protagonist's life. The director mistakes mental strength to be the pitch of his characters - they constantly need to shout to garner attention, even if they don't make any sense. In every random scene, Vijay says 'We're Indians' or 'I'm a fighter'. As a viewer though, the only fight is with your tolerance levels. Ronit Roy's only job is to remind Liger to 'Focus, focus and focus!!'

Liger is remotely tolerable as long as the film is set in Mumbai. Once Vijay leaves for the US, the film falls apart like a pack of cards. From music to cinematography and the patchy production design and the supposed scale, there's no department in Liger that can even remotely distract the viewers and do some minimal damage control. The background score is painfully amateurish and the song situations are lazily designed. Most sequences are shot in Hindi and have been dubbed in Telugu later.

The stunt choreography is unimaginative, to put it mildly. In a scene, the baddies and Vijay keep slapping each other in a supposed display of their machismo. Was this supposed to be an unintentional dig at Arjun Reddy? Ali and Getup Srinu's characters are wasted efforts to tickle your funny bones. In fact, it is Mike Tyson's laughable cameo that makes the viewer laugh at his own plight. Chunky Pandey and Vishu Reddy are hapless even in their minimal screen time.

Vijay Deverakonda is a total misfit in Puri Jagannadh's universe - his stuttering makes no impact at all. He solely trusted the filmmaker with this and the latter lets him down big time. One can conveniently blame Ananya Panday for the absence of any screen presence, but could any other actress have done a better job with such a one-note character? Bad films leave you with a migraine but Liger isn't even capable of that. It's that forgettable.

Liger, simply put, is a catastrophe. You had to take Vijay Deverakonda seriously when he said 'Waat Laga Denge'. Even 15-minute short films have more to tell than what Liger has to say in over 140 minutes.

review_title: As pointless as one expects it to be.
review_detailed_main:
The journey of Tanya_underskirt to Tanya_theStar would have looked a better story than Liger's journey into the world of MMA. Puri's haphazard writing combined with his trademark direction, ended up giving a really bad film which tests one's patience right from the first act. I even thought about stopping the movie on Hotstar half a dozen times within the first half itself. The story is about Liger's (THE Vijay Devarakonda) mother Balamani (Ramya Krishna) wanting him to become a National level MMA champion. She gets Christopher (Ronit Roy) to be his coach for free and one of Christopher's condition is no girls as they cause distraction. Enters Tanya (Ananya Panday) who distracts Liger and then breaks up with him. His stammering being the reason for break up is the only natural thing Tanya does in the entire movie. How Liger overcomes the heartbreak and turns his focus to be the champion he is meant to be, but this is not that kind of movie.

The first act itself has enough scenes that trigger with Puri's trademark dialogues. All the Tolly actors have spoken their lines in Telugu while the Bolly actors speaking their lines in Hindi. The lip sync gave it away, I can only wonder how fun was it shoot that way. The screenplay is something one expected to come across an early 2000s bad movie. And that third act involving Mike Tyson which made no sense and looked so forced into the script like a last minute addition. May be if one watches this as a parody movie then it can be enjoyed otherwise sitting through this is a sheer torture.

review_title: Entertaining and fun with insightful life lessons
review_detailed_main:
I enjoyed this entertaining funny movie also because it has nice life lessons in it. I.e. About focus, avoiding distractions.

People find it sexist and have given it a bad rating. But nothing sexist about telling men to focus on their own goals and not chase women. Or to not take validation from women they like too seriously.

It was funny, and Vijay acted well in spite of bad feedback from others here.

A must-watch for young bachelor men. Women and men in relationships may not like it. But bachelor men can empathize with the main character.

Only complaints are some of the unrealistic action scenes where people getting hit are flying in the air. That should be avoided.

I'm not sure whether script was off or the acting. Everything seems way too messed up and its literally a torture for the audience. Ananya was terrible in her acting and Vijay did his best to get in shape for the role but failed to measure up for the audience 's expectations. Songs were all over the place. Its a waste of time and money. I was expecting an action flick with a better script but yep I was disappointed. Songs were fine to listen but it was definitely not placed at proper intervals and that made it poor to even watch. I literally sat to watch it since I've spend a lot of money for the tickets otherwise its literal hell to even watch a single scene.

review_title: Liger is First Indian action movie based on Mixed Martial Arts (MMA), also featuring former boxer Mike Tyson
review_detailed_main:
I bet, if you enjoy watching hardcore masala action movies, you are gonna like Liger for sure. You won't be disappointed at all. Liger is a collaboration of Dharma Productions and Tollywood's Puri Connects production, but mostly influenced by South Indian movie styles, this is why it has so many hardcore fights and actions right from start to end which keeps pumping the blood with fun and thrill.

Directed by Puri Jagannath, the same who also directed a blockbuster action flick Pokiri in 2006 starring Mahesh Babu, which was later remade as Wanted in Bollywood in 2009.

Liger, the titular role played by Vijay Deverakonda, is an aspirant martial artist who wants to achieve world MMA championship title, which was left incomplete by his father. He joins in a free training centre run by Ronit Roy for professional training.

In the beginning, he gets ragged by other fellow students/trainees but slowly he becomes everyone's choice due to his impressive fighting skill. He also meets a cute and lovely social media influential girl Ananya Pandey, who easily falls for him.

If I'm not wrong, Liger is the first Indian movie which is based on MMA which also features real life globally famous boxer Mike Tyson. Earlier Tyson appeared in cameo role as himself in Sunny Deol-Shahid Kapoor starrer Fool N Final in 2007. He also appeared in a popular Chinese movie Ip Man 3 as opponent of Donnie Yen.

Ramya Krishnan and Ronit Roy well justified their respective roles of Vijay's mother and a his MMA trainer (and fighter).

The only downside is childish and immature character role written for Ananya Pandey. From start her role as a social media influencer is so ridiculous at most times.

Overall Liger is a paisa wasool masala action entertainer with high dose of action stunts by Vijay Deverakonda.

Watch it in cinemas, you won't regret👌👍

The Film was super good but I don't know why people are saying its too bad instead of saying Average if they feel boring, Why to ruin their 3 Years of hardwook? Watch with interest and presence of mind. Then you'll understand the movie.

I bet, if you enjoy watching hardcore masala action movies, you are gonna like Liger for sure. You won't be disappointed at all. Liger is a collaboration of Dharma Productions and Tollywood's Puri Connects production, but mostly influenced by South Indian movie styles, this is why it has so many hardcore fights and actions right from start to end which keeps pumping the blood with fun and thrill.

Directed by , the same who also directed a blockbuster action flick in 2006 starring , which was later remade as Wanted in Bollywood in 2009.

Liger, the titular role played by Vijay Deverakonda, is an aspirant martial artist who wants to achieve world MMA championship title, which was left incomplete by his father. He joins in a free training centre run by Ronit Roy for professional training.

In the beginning, he gets ragged by other fellow students/trainees but slowly he becomes everyone's choice due to his impressive fighting skill. He also meets a cute and lovely social media influential girl Ananya Pandey, who easily falls for him.

Technical values : Director Puri Jagannadh's basic idea of making a film on mother sentiment and incorporating action part in it is good but completely dilutes the proceedings with his routine template writing.
